com.robopupu.api.mvp

Class PluginActivity<T_Presenter extends Presenter>

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppCompatActivity
      • com.robopupu.api.mvp.ViewActivity<T_Presenter>
        • com.robopupu.api.mvp.PluginActivity<T_Presenter>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Scopeable, FeatureContainer, FeatureContainerActivity, FeatureTransitionManager, PresentedView<T_Presenter>, View, PluginComponent

    public abstract class PluginActivity<T_Presenter extends Presenter>
extends ViewActivity<T_Presenter>
implements FeatureContainer, FeatureContainerActivity, PluginComponent
    PluginActivity extends ViewActivity to provide an abstract base class for implementing Activities that utilise Robopupu.Plugin library.

      • canShowView

        public boolean canShowView(View view)
        Tests if the given View can be shown. The default implementation of this method just checks that this ViewActivity has not been moved to background.
        Specified by:
        canShowView in interface FeatureTransitionManager
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • showDialogFragment

        public void showDialogFragment(FeatureDialogFragment dialogFragment,
                               boolean addToBackStack,
                               java.lang.String fragmentTag)
        Description copied from interface: FeatureTransitionManager
        Shows the given FeatureDialogFragment. Each shown FeatureDialogFragment instance has to be supplied with a tag that can be used to retrieve the instance later on. If parameter fragmentTag is given null value, the tag is set to be the class name of the FeatureFragment.
        Specified by:
        showDialogFragment in interface FeatureTransitionManager
        Parameters:
        dialogFragment - A FeatureDialogFragment. May not be null.
        addToBackStack - A boolean value specifying if the View is added to back stack.
        fragmentTag - If the FeatureDialogFragment is to be added to back stack then a String used as a tag to identify the FeatureDialogFragment has to be given. In most cases tag can be simply the class name of the FeatureDialogFragment. If null then the FeatureDialogFragment is not added to back stack
